Posts.EditableText: My game is being really large. I'm trying to get it ready for ifcomp and I'm wondering if it would be better to make it into a zip file containing the quest program also, but I'm unsure what this would look like or how I would do this. Is it possible?
Posts.HTML: My game is being really large. I'm trying to get it ready for ifcomp and I'm wondering if it would be better to make it into a zip file containing the quest program also, but I'm unsure what this would look like or how I would do this. Is it possible?

Posts.EditableText: If you publish your game, Quest creates a .quest-file which is a zip container
Posts.HTML: If you publish your game, Quest creates a .quest-file which is a zip container

Posts.EditableText: Does that zipped file contain the quest program also? As in, if someone were to download that file, would they automatically be able to play it on there computer?
Posts.HTML: Does that zipped file contain the quest program also? As in, if someone were to download that file, would they automatically be able to play it on there computer?

Posts.EditableText: Maybe the larger issue I'm having is that my published game is larger the 20mb
Posts.HTML: Maybe the larger issue I'm having is that my published game is larger the 20mb

Posts.EditableText:
Having a .quest file greater than 20 mb will be a problem. There is a bit on this page about that:
http://docs.textadventures.co.uk/quest/publishing.html
Posts.HTML:
Having a .quest file greater than 20 mb will be a problem. There is a bit on this page about that:
http://docs.textadventures.co.uk/quest/publishing.html

Posts.EditableText: Is it possible to zip the game file with the quest program and have it all easily play? I'm not sure how that would work.
Posts.HTML: Is it possible to zip the game file with the quest program and have it all easily play? I'm not sure how that would work.
